column2: the Eskdale pioneer did not forget his mother. For years he had constantly written to her
column4: so that the letters might be more easily read by her aged eyes; he had sent her money in full proportion to his means; and he had taken every possible care to let her declining years be as comfortable as his altered circumstances could readily make them. And now
column5: in the midst of this great and responsible work
column6: he found time to "run down" to Eskdale (very different "running down" from that which we ourselves can do by the London and North Western Railway)
column7: to see his aged mother once more before she died. What a meeting that must have been
column8: between the poor old widow of the Eskdale shepherd
column11: and engineer of the great and important Ellesmere Canal!
